thread.title: Barnabas Kirui three-peats at Komen Dallas Race for the Cure, Area race results
thread.title_full: Barnabas Kirui three-peats at Komen Dallas Race for the Cure, Area race results | Dallas Morning News

author: Debbie Fetterman
title: Barnabas Kirui three-peats at Komen Dallas Race for the Cure, Area race results
text:
Dallas' Barnabas Kirui won his third consecutive Komen Dallas Race for the Cure Saturday at NorthPark Center. Kirui completed the 5K course in 15 minutes, 46 seconds. He was five seconds ahead of runner up Jason Trevino (15:51). Clint Bell finished third in 16:02, and Agustin Hernandez was fourth overall in 16:25.
Portland, Maine's Michelle Lilienthal won the women's overall title in 17:23 and placed sixth overall. Women's runner-up Michelle Gaye of Coppell finished seventh overall in 17:45. Bree Schrader of Austin was the third woman and placed eighth overall in 17:58.
Michelle Huff of Evening Shade, Ariz. captured the survivor title, finishing in 22:30. Valley View's Tawni Luke and Plano's Gennifer Stratton, both previous survivor division winners, placed second and third in 22:41 and 24:24, respectively.
Numerous area runners were disappointed that the event didn't present age group awards. Age group results were released in 10-year increments rather than the traditional five-year divisions.
Dallas Komen Chapter's interim executive director, Chris Packard, said there have been several changes in leadership over the months leading up to the race. Many race-day details needed attention including the overall participation and survivor experience.
"It was an oversight," Packard said. "We heard it loud and clear. Age-group awards will be back next year."
Briefly : Clyde Shank finished his 50 States quest for the second time at Saturday's Monster Mash Marathon in Dover, Delaware ... Angela Tortorice completed her fourth 50 States effort when she crossed the finish line of the Super Hero Marathon in Vermont on Oct. 11.
